page.title: 15Norham Castle
page.content: No matter where you might stand in Norham you can be pretty certain you'll always be able to see the castle. It stands high up on a hill keeping watch over the quiet little village. Norhams' first castle was built round about 1121 of wood. The present massive stone Keep was built about 1154 and would surely have been the hub of the area. In the course of the next 437 years it was besieged 14 times and captured 7 times,until falling into disuse in 1603 after the Union of the Crowns. The masonry for the older houses in the village and Morris Hall all are built from the ruins. Since 1925 it has been maintained as an Ancient Monument and is open 9.30 - 1800 in summer, 9.30 - 1600 in winter.
